item.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 Side Events schedule: Women in Tech, MongoDB, Silkroad Innovation Hub, and more to host (AI News & Artificial Intelligence | TechCrunch)
item.description:
With TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 right around the corner, we’re thrilled to introduce the companies hosting Side Events that will extend the buzz and excitement to the thousands of attendees and Silicon Valley locals alike.

Whether it’s a fun happy hour, insightful panels, or energizing morning runs, Disrupt Week — happening from October 25-31 — offers an exciting array of Side Events organized by a diverse group of participating companies.

Scroll down to explore 50+ Side Events, built so you can connect with 10,000 Disrupt attendees and the rest of the Bay Area tech scene. Make sure to register for your Disrupt pass so you can be at the heart of the tech scene buzz. Save up to $444 on your pass and get 60% off a second pass.

Side Event guidelines and disclaimers

  • Registering/RSVPing to a Side Event does not grant you access/ticket/badge to TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, taking place October 27-29.
  • Each event is organized and operated solely by a host (not TechCrunch or any of its affiliates).
  • Attendance is 18+ minimum, and some venues are 21+ only.
  • Side Events are open to the public unless specified.
  • Please register/RSVP for any of the Side Events you want to attend.

Featured Side Events

JetBrains Night in San Francisco
Monday, October 27, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted by JetBrains
JetBrains invites you to an exclusive night of fun and connection at Emporium Arcade Bar during TechCrunch Disrupt in San Francisco. Get ready for an unforgettable evening of networking and arcade games, all in a relaxed, vibrant setting. Dive into the future of development with our thought leadership panel on agentic AI for professional developers and connect with the brightest minds in tech. This private, invitation-only event is where fun meets innovation, and ideas turn into opportunities. Let’s code, play, and shape the future together!

Central Eurasian Founders and Community Meet-up
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted by Silkroad Innovation Hub
Join us for the Central Eurasian Founders and Community Meet-up, hosted by Silkroad Innovation Hub as a side event to TechCrunch. This gathering brings together startup founders, investors, and ecosystem leaders from across Central Eurasia and Silicon Valley. Expect dynamic networking, inspiring founder stories, and new cross-border connections that highlight the region’s growing role in the global innovation landscape.

VIP Penthouse After-Hours with MongoDB & Google Cloud
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by MongoDB
VIP Penthouse After-Hours with MongoDB & Google Cloud is an exclusive, invite-only networking event that brings together tech innovators, startup leaders, cloud architects, and data professionals for an evening of high-level conversations and curated experiences. Held in a luxurious penthouse setting above the city skyline, the event blends sophisticated ambiance with cutting-edge technology discussions, offering attendees the opportunity to connect directly with MongoDB and Google Cloud experts.

TechCrunch Disrupt After-Party hosted by Mercury
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Mercury
​After a full day of big ideas at TechCrunch Disrupt, join us just minutes from Moscone for Mercury’s after-party: a space to slow down, connect with fellow builders, and celebrate the details that define your journey. No panels, no pitches — just good food, craft cocktails, and great company.

​Didn’t attend TechCrunch Disrupt? You’re still welcome to stop by.

All Aboard the Future: Poland & Silicon Valley Ignite the Next Wave of Innovation
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Polish Investment and Trade Agency
Step aboard the Historic Klamath Ship at Pier 9 on October 28 at 5 p.m. for an unforgettable night of bold ideas, breakthrough innovation, and powerful connections. Meet Poland’s top startups, visionary innovators, and government leaders driving the next wave of global tech. Enjoy delicious European cuisine and authentic Polish drinks and mingle with inspiring founders and investors. Special highlight: Be there for an exclusive announcement unveiling a new era of collaboration between Poland and Silicon Valley, a partnership set to become the next global hub for breakthrough ideas and cutting-edge technologies.

Irish Tech Pitch Night
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Enterprise Ireland
Enterprise Ireland is back at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 and we are so excited to welcome old friends and meet new ones at our Pitch Night in Ireland House on Tuesday of TechCrunch Disrupt Week! There we’ll hear pitches from 10 Irish startups on the night: Jarvio, Cergenx, Glitch, Magnate, Kayna, Akara, Hyperpath, Oscil, Oraion, CosoAI! Please register now as availability is limited!

Women Tech Meetup
Thursday, October 30, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Women Tech Meetup
San Francisco! Calling all female founders, allies, friends, and partners!
​​​​Let’s be real — fundraising isn’t one-size-fits-all. And for women founders? The rules aren’t just different — they’re nonexistent. That’s why we’re bringing together a powerhouse room of female founders, funders, and operators to talk about raising capital your way.

Saturday, October 25

Founders Running Club @ TechCrunch Disrupt
Saturday, October 25, 2025
9:30 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.
Hosted by Founders Running Club

We host weekly runs in San Francisco and 46 other locations worldwide for founders, their friends and families, investors, creators, tech professionals, and anyone interested. This time, we’re excited to again be part of TechCrunch Disrupt! The focus is on community and connection, not pushing yourself too hard.
RSVP

CREATANT AI x Creativity: Real-World Workflows, Demos, and Collaboration
Saturday, October 25, 2025
2:00 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
Hosted by CREATANT, Inc.
Join the CREATANT creative tech exchange to learn how creatives in Japan, Europe, and the U.S. are using AI for design, film, and more. The event offers live demos, real-world case studies, and open discussions on AI’s strengths and limitations. It’s a hands-on experience for creative professionals and marketers to explore new AI workflows, network, and exchange ideas with technologists and collaborators.
RSVP

Sunday, October 26

Rise & Grind SF: Coffee Rave + Live Podcast
Sunday, October 26, 2025
8:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.
Hosted by LaunchLink Communications
Consider Rise & Grind SF your Disrupt Week pregame. Part morning dance party, part live podcast, 100% good vibes.
Expect fresh brews, hot beats, and authentic connections. Whether you’re a founder, investor, or ecosystem partner, this is your daily dose of big ideas to set the tone for the week, courtesy of LaunchLink Comms + Humble Brags Podcast. Once you’re boogied out, a major Silicon Valley founder (think multibillion-dollar household name 👀) takes the mic for a live Humble Brags recording: unfiltered stories on building, breaking, and reinventing the game. Guest DJs + big brand collabs dropping soon. Come solo or with pals for coffee, connection, and a double shot of wisdom.

The Future of Work Mixer + Open Demos: Worktech, Agentic AI & Robotics
Sunday, October 26, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Good4work + Ontology of Value
Join us in the beautiful Minna Gallery, downtown San Francisco, for a social mixer and open demos, on the eve of the biggest tech conference in San Francisco, TechCrunch Disrupt 2025!

​We are a community focused on building (and disrupting!) the future of work — sharing and promoting innovation in work tech, agentic AI, and robotics so that humans and AI can happily cohabitate in the labor market and build a wonderful economy together.

​This time around, we are putting together a social mixer — whether you are a builder, operator, or investor, join us and let’s share our solutions and our lessons!
RSVP

AI SaaS Builder’s Networking Night
Sunday, October 26, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 9:30 p.m.
Hosted by askitmore
This event brings together aspiring entrepreneurs and startup enthusiasts to create professional slides using Snapdeck and pitch their ideas directly.

Pitch participants will prepare their presentation materials on-site using Snapdeck, then present their ideas for 3 minutes. General attendees can watch the presentations and vote for their top 1-3 most impressive teams.

During the networking session that follows, participants can enjoy free pizza and drinks while freely connecting with entrepreneurs, aspiring founders from diverse backgrounds to explore new opportunities.
RSVP

Monday, October 27

Future Shock: SOSV & KIAC
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by SOSV
🎬 Back to the Future? Absolutely.
This isn’t another stiff networking panel. Think flux capacitor energy: rice wine, demos glowing, and conversations skipping across borders and time zones. A gathering where casual meets geeky, and nerdy meets meaningful.
​​What to expect
​​Networking: Casual, high‑energy mixer designed for real conversations.
​Showcases and a few tables where startups showcase demos to maximize conditions for high‑quality collisions.

Ping Pong After Panels
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Scrut Automation
Scrut Automation is calling all CEOs, CTOs, founders, and CISO/VP of engineering to our “Ping Pong After Panels” After-Party. This is the official wind-down — a no-pitch, no-pressure zone to celebrate a hard day’s work.

Connect with fellow attendees over cold drinks, great food, and a little friendly competition. We’re swapping the formal handshakes for high fives and the buzz of the conference floor for a much better soundtrack. Plus, everything’s on us. Just come ready to relax and roll. ~This event has limited capacity and will fill up quickly. RSVP now to claim your spot~

Founders Happy Hour and Fireside Chat: Avoiding Identity and Compliance Scope Creep 👻 Hosted by Descope & Delve
Monday, October 27, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Descope
High-growth startups have tough decisions to make as they scale. As much as builders love to build, if everything is managed in-house with grit, sweat, and tears, growth will stall.
Join us for beer, pizza, networking, and an unfiltered fireside chat with founders from Descope and Delve.

Unlock Your Investor Potential: How Tech Workers Can Become LPs Using Vested Stock Units
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by Musa Capital
Are you a technology professional with vested stock units from companies like Google, Amazon, or Apple? Curious about how you can leverage those assets to become a limited partner (LP) in a venture capital (VC) fund? Join us for an exclusive Office Hours event where we’ll guide you through the process of converting your vested stock units into investments in VC funds.
RSVP

Exclusive Gathering of Founders Beyond Seed and Series A and Accredited Investors
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Equity X Investments, Vataseason, and Plus Ultra Capital Partners
An exclusive, invite-only gathering for post-seed and post-Series A founders and accredited investors.
No pitches or panels. Just high-value networking and real conversations over curated drinks in an intimate setting. Expect a vetted guest list and great opportunities for highly accomplished founders to meet partners of VCs and vice versa.
RSVP

Pitch&Drink with P2S.VC
Monday, October 27, 2025
7:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Pre-seed to succeed (AltaIR Capital, Yellow Rocks!, Smart Partnership Capital, I2BF Global Ventures)
Calling all founders looking for INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES to Pitch&Drink with P2S.vc!  Connect with a community of like-minded individuals and VCs and gain insights into your next fundraising venture in a relaxed and fun environment.

Think of it as venture speed dating. Founders will have 2–3 minutes to present their elevator pitch (no presentation) directly to investors, followed by a 6- to 7-minute Q&A session.
RSVP

TechCrunch Disrupt “Unofficial Afterparty” at Werqwise SF
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Silicon Valley Venture, LLC
Kick off TechCrunch Day 1 at our after-party, hosted by Brian Sparkes, CEO of Silicon Valley Venture and host of Silicon Valley Impact Podcast. This is The Day 1 Mixer — where founders, investors, and innovators gather to celebrate, connect, and unwind. Expect a curated crowd, high-energy vibe, cocktails, and conversations that spark real opportunities. No panels, no pitches — just celebration and connection at the top Silicon Valley after-party.
RSVP

South Asian Collective @ TechCrunch Disrupt Week
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:15 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by American South Asian Network (ASAN)
South Asian and under 50? Join us for an engaging evening of networking, insightful discussions, and cultural celebration. Connect with South Asian entrepreneurs, creatives, and professionals, and explore the vibrant contributions of the South Asian community across various industries.
What to expect
​✨ Powerful Networking
​🔥 Founder & Investor Spotlights
​🥂 Mixer & Social”
RSVP

Beyond the Hype: Voices from the Future of Humane AI — Short Film Screening & Panel
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by Building Humane Tech
Join us for an intimate screening of our documentary short featuring AI researchers, cognitive scientists, and innovative builders who are reimagining how we develop artificial intelligence. Followed by an informal panel and open discussion. This isn’t your typical tech panel — it’s a glimpse into a movement of interdisciplinary thinkers challenging the dominant Silicon Valley narrative, with folks like Danielle Perszyk from Amazon’s AI lab and Daniel Bashir from OpenAI.
RSVP

Unofficial Welcome Party: Bullish or Bust? A Rooftop AI Debate with Baseten, Premji Invest, and Treble PR
Monday, October 27, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Treble PR and Premji Invest
Join us after Day 1 of TechCrunch Disrupt for an invite-only night with AI founders and builders. Expect drinks, bites, and a conversation that’s equal parts real talk and future-gazing, cohosted by Premji Invest, a leading AI early-stage investor, and Treble PR, a San Francisco-based tech PR agency working with emerging leaders in AI.

Tuhin Srivastava of Baseten and Sandesh Patnam of Premji Invest, will answer questions from Reuters reporter Krystal Hu on why they’re still bullish on AI among eye-watering valuations and talk of a bubble.
RSVP

Night Zero: Unofficial Opening Party at TechCrunch Disrupt Week
Monday, October 27, 2025
8:00 p.m. – 10:30 p.m.
Hosted by Fox Rothschild and Silicon Valley Bank
Opening Night after-party in the heart of San Francisco hosted by Fox Rothschild and Silicon Valley Bank, with special partner UnDavos. Enjoy cocktails, light bites, and award-winning headliner DJ Samantha Michelle (Plaza Athénée/KitKatClub/SXSW/Soho House) in a premier venue designed for connection and celebration.

Bring your team to connect with other leading VCs and founders who are together shaping the future of tech. This is where partnerships are born and the night comes alive. Capacity is limited. Please apply to attend.
RSVP

Tuesday, October 28

Llama Lounge 21: The AI Startup Event Series at Capgemini
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Llama Lounge
Hundreds of AI Founders, VCs, and corporate AI buyers will assemble to hear 10 pitches from AI startups and 5 “reverse pitches” from top corporations who seek AI startup partners. This event is a mixture of AI leaders, pitches, demo tables, and lots of networking. Food and beverage provided. Led by Jeremiah Owyang, hosted at Capgemini.

The AI Renaissance in Gaming, Film, and VR
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by AIX Ventures
The last 3 years saw massive AI adoption for text-based applications. Its adoption in gaming, film, and VR has been limited by poor outputs and a lack of industry-specific applications. That’s rapidly changing.
Join AIX Ventures for a panel to discuss how new models and methods are poised to rapidly democratize the creation of immersive worlds and films.
Moderated by TechCrunch’s Russel Brandom, the panel will include Chris Manning, General Partner at AIX Ventures & fmr. Director of SAIL, and Fan‑Yun Sun and Sharon Lee, Founders of Moonlake AI, an AI research lab that allows anyone to create playable interactive worlds in minutes.

The After Crunch Party
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Salesbricks
Experience the Buzz of Asian Street Markets as we take TechCrunch Disrupt After Hours to a new level!
Join us at Polkcha, where craft cocktails meet the vibrant energy of Asian street markets — neon lights, bold flavors, and unforgettable vibes. Hosted by Salesbricks, Intercom, Sprinto, AutonomyAI, and Persana.

Black Box Session
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
4:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by Israel Foreign Trade Administration
Meet and have early conversations with some of the most promising Israeli cyber startups. Black Box Session is an invite-only, off-the-record networking + happy hour for VCs and security practitioners during TechCrunch Disrupt week. Expect meaningful connections and practical takeaways — no decks, no pitches. Tuesday, 4:30 p.m. –7:30 p.m., private FiDi venue. Request-to-attend; approved guests receive location, QR, and day-of details.

SaaS/AI Founder + Investor Happy Hour
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by NachoNacho + Services Marketplace, Deel, Anchin, and Shopline
Join us for an exclusive evening of networking with top SaaS and AI founders, investors, and tech leaders. Enjoy curated conversations over sponsored drinks and food as we bring together innovators shaping the next wave of tech. Attendance is by approval only — no plus-ones. Space is limited, so apply early to secure your spot.
RSVP

『Shinhan Square Bridge』 (S²Bridge) K-Innovators’ Pitch Night
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by SWITH
K-Innovators’ Night of Pitch & Networking
An exclusive evening of pitches and networking with Korea’s leading innovators. Meet and mingle with 9 standout startups, including TechCrunch Disrupt’s Startup Battlefield 200 participants! Build new connections with K-innovators and discover new ideas as you spark conversations. Food and drinks on SWITH. RSVP required — seats are limited.
RSVP

Beats & Builds Happy Hour with 219 Design and Beacon Launch Partners
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by 219 Design and Beacon Launch Partners
An exclusive evening at our classic San Francisco engineering shop — just a 15-minute walk from Moscone — savoring local craft beer, cocktails, tasty bites, and a live DJ.

This is a chance to unwind, get inspired, and spark new ideas alongside teams who live and breathe product development every day. Explore a collection of cutting-edge prototypes from a variety of industries and engage in conversations with the engineers, designers, and strategists behind breakthrough products. 21+
RSVP

Maize & Blue Happy Hour with U-M CFE
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by University of Michigan Center for Entrepreneurship
Join fellow University of Michigan alumni and friends for a casual meetup during TechCrunch Disrupt! Hosted by the Center for Entrepreneurship, this is a great opportunity to reconnect, expand your network, and celebrate innovation — with a Michigan twist. Whether you’re a founder, investor, technologist, or just love maize & blue, come share your startup spirit with us! Go Blue!
RSVP

Founder & Investor Happy Hour During TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by McDermott Will & Schulte, BDO, and Berkeley Angel Network
Join fellow TechCrunch Disrupt founders and investors for a fresh take on networking at the Founder and Investor Happy Hour hosted by McDermott Will & Schulte, BDO, and Berkeley Angel Network. Meet key innovators within the global tech community, exchange ideas, and forge new connections to drive your business forward. Don’t miss your chance to join this exclusive night of networking and enjoy some of the best rooftop views San Francisco has to offer — register today!
RSVP

Why Most Startups Don’t Scale: The 15 GTM Mistakes Nobody Talks About
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by Entry Point 1
You’ve nailed the product. You’ve raised the round. The team is running full speed. But the results don’t add up. Pipeline’s soft. Conversion’s flat. Revenue’s unpredictable. Is it the messaging? The team? The motion? Or is something more foundational — and systemic — getting in your way? This isn’t a hype session. It’s a teardown of the 15 GTM problems that stop great companies from scaling. Each one’s based on real data, real leadership stories from Silicon Valley, and real pain.
RSVP

The Robotics Wave: The New Era of Embodied Intelligence
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by INNOVIT — Italian Innovation & Cultural Hub
Let’s explore how AI and hardware are converging to create intelligent physical systems. Discover innovative robotics, embodied AI, and smart sensors revolutionizing manufacturing, healthcare, and autonomous systems. Attendees will attend a discussion panel with speakers on breakthrough technologies, and networking opportunities with industry pioneers shaping the future of intelligent machines and physical AI applications.
RSVP

PILAF AFTER-PARTY: Visionaries’ Rooftop Gathering
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted by Innova and BeGlobe
When the final session closes, the city’s most influential minds ascend to the skyline. Join us for the Legendary Pilaf After-Party, a private rooftop gathering where cutting-edge innovation meets the world’s finest culinary. The evening Includes:
​- Gourmet Pilaf Tasting: Tradition elevated to haute cuisine.
​- Visionary Networking: Intimate conversations with the leaders shaping the future.
RSVP

How AI Is Transforming Biomanufacturing
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by SOSV
Bits in Bio is thrilled to present “How AI Is Transforming Biomanufacturing,” a one-night event of candid conversations from experienced executives on the front lines of biomanufacturing. ​Our panel includes a range of perspectives carefully curated to drive meaningful insight on the future of this exciting field.

Global Founders Panel
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Young Professionals of San Francisco + Swedish American Chamber of Commerce
During TechCrunch Disrupt week, we’re bringing together a community of young doers, builders, and dreamers for an evening that blends the best of Swedish and American entrepreneurship. The Global Founders Panel is designed to spark ideas, celebrate bold thinking, and create meaningful connections that last well beyond the night.
Program highlights
• Founder Panel: Entrepreneurs share real stories from the startup frontlines.
• Spotlight Sessions: Quick-fire showcases of ventures that are pushing boundaries.
• Networking Mixer: Meet founders, investors, and young professionals shaping what’s next.

Disrupt the Piñata: Startup–VC Mixer with a Latin Twist
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Unibaio
Step into a one-of-a-kind networking experience where Latin American creativity meets startup innovation. In Disrupt the Piñata, attendees drop their business cards or one-liners into a colorful piñata filled with sweet surprises. Once it’s broken, everyone grabs a card at random, introduces the startup they picked to the group, and then connects directly with that founder.

This playful icebreaker ensures every participant gets visibility, sparks unexpected connections, and sets the stage for deeper conversations. With a mix of fun, culture, and serious business opportunities, Disrupt the Piñata is the perfect side event to showcase Latin startups and foster genuine VC–founder relationships.

Founders, Funders & the Future of Care Mixer
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Morrison & Foerster Law Firm and Vital Audio
This invite-only happy hour will bring together 90–120 curated guests of decision-makers shaping the future of healthcare, including early-stage investors, hospital and virtual-care operators, digital health founders, and TechCrunch media. Expect a dynamic program featuring:

  • Founders Spotlight: Short sessions highlighting rising founders and product showcase.
  • Sponsor Shoutouts: Premium visibility and recognition for our partners.
  • Curated Networking: 2.5 hours of conversations, connections, and collaboration over drinks and light catering.
    RSVP

Disrupt Music @ EMPIRE Studios by Nebula
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Nebula, sponsored by EMPIRE
Mixer happy hour with a DJ spinning live music, snacks and drinks at EMPIRE RECORDS Studios hosted by Nebula.

EMPIRE is a partner and investor of Nebula (a member of Battlefield 200) and is the largest independent record label in the world. EMPIRE, founded by Ghazi, is a San Francisco-born tech-first record label that pioneered the distribution space.

The event will include press, tech entrepreneurs, investors, established artists, and top management of EMPIRE, along with the Nebula co-founders. The mixer will be free entry, RSVP-only (via the RSVPify app).
RSVP

Silicon Valley x PeakNIL: The Future of Sports, Tech and Start Ups
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by PeakNIL
Kick back with PeakNIL at our happy hour where athletes, founders, and investors collide. Grab a drink, meet PeakNIL co-founder, chief strategy officer, and LA Ram Blake Corum, and discover how NIL is shaking up the business of sports and culture. Expect networking, fresh ideas, and a good time with the team behind the fastest growing NIL company.
RSVP

AI-Matched Private Dinners with TechTable by Cyber Pop-up
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
7:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Cyber Pop-up
TechTable connects professionals through curated, AI-matched private dining that sparks authentic conversations. Attendees take a short vibe quiz, and our algorithm pairs them with 6 like-minded peers for intimate dinners at nice local restaurants. Each table gets curated conversation cards on tech, AI, and more — creating space for meaningful dialogue without the chaos of big networking rooms. No awkward small talk, just inspiring people, real connections, and great food.
RSVP

SignalFire’s Disrupt Poolside After-Party
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
7:00 p.m. – Midnight
Hosted by SignalFire
The most talked-about after-party at TechCrunch Disrupt is back!
​Last year, our Disrupt Penthouse After-Party drew over 3,000 registrations, but we could only accommodate a fraction of attendees. It became the most exclusive and talked-about event of the week, bringing together founders, investors, and top tech operators for a night of high-energy connection and celebration.

​This year, we’re leveling up and going poolside 🌴💦.
New venue. Bigger capacity. Even better vibes.

​We’re taking over an iconic San Francisco location for one unforgettable night. We’ll have immersive experiences, live musical performances, and fun surprises that will make it the highlight of your Disrupt week.

Wednesday, October 29

Tech Meets Tavern Happy Hour
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by OneSignal
You’ve been pitching, networking, and learning all day. Now it’s time to kick back at OneSignal’s exclusive post-Disrupt happy hour.

Join us at the iconic Wayfare Tavern, located less than a mile from the conference. You can enjoy premium cocktails, gourmet hors d’oeuvres (bring your appetite!), and great conversation with fellow founders, marketers, and tech innovators in a relaxed and upscale setting that is perfect for unwinding after a busy day.
RSVP

HardTech After Party @Whipsaw
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Whipsaw
Are you building the future of hardware? Come connect with fellow founders, engineers, and investors who are pushing the boundaries of hard tech from robotics and wearables to connected devices, medtech, and beyond.

​An evening of conversation, community, and collaboration for hardware enthusiasts straight from the TechCrunch Disrupt floor. Enjoy delicious food and drinks, all set to the sounds of a live DJ. Expect a mix of deep tech founders, product innovators, and design leaders who are solving real-world problems with bold hardware solutions.
RSVP

UAtech Venture Night @Disrupt – The Ultimate Startup & Investor Experience!
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted b y UAtech
UAtech Venture Night @ Disrupt is a fast-paced pitch competition where early-stage founders present sharp 3-minute pitches to an audience of active investors and tech leaders. Live scoring and rapid Q&A keep the energy high and deal-focused. A panel discussion with industry experts sets the stage, followed by an awards ceremony and active networking — connecting capital, ideas, and innovation to fuel the next wave of global tech.
RSVP

Fright Night: Product Failures
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by blok
Halloween is around the corner, and so are the ghosts of failed launches, terrifying drop-offs, and features that should have stayed buried. Join us on October 29 for Fright Night: Product Failures, an evening of product horror stories, haunted prototypes, and live simulations that expose what really scared users away. Expect spooky vibes, cathartic laughs, and a fresh look at how product teams can turn their worst nightmares into future wins.
RSVP

Incheon Rise-Up IR/ Showcase Day
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Draper Startup House Korea
​The Rise-up Pitch Showcase organized by Draper Startup House Korea, Draper University and Nuleep, brings together 6 of Korea’s most promising startups for an exclusive pitch event in Silicon Valley. Handpicked through a highly selective process, these companies are beyond early stage — they’re ready to attract investment and secure strategic partnerships that will accelerate their U.S. expansion. This is a rare opportunity to meet the next generation of Korean innovators, each equipped with the technology, resilience, and global readiness to scale successfully in the world’s most competitive market.

Meet & Match in Tech: Founders Hiring × Devs Exploring
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Beta University
Where builders, backers, and bold ideas collide.
​Join us for the must-attend social of TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 — an evening designed for high-energy networking, real conversations, and unexpected collisions.
​Whether you’re a founder fundraising, a VC sourcing your next breakout bet, or an operator looking to plug into the ecosystem, Founderverse is where it all comes together.
What to expect:
​🚀 Founders, VCs, and tech operators
​⚡ Lightning pitches from rising startups
​🏷️ Color-coded badges (so you know who’s who)
​🍸 Drinks, music, and no-bullshit networking
No panels. No fluff. Just the right people in the right room. ​Spots are limited — RSVP required.

Techcrunch event

San Francisco | October 27-29, 2025

SISU x Fund/Build/Scale LIVE Podcast & Mixer
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:30 p.m.
Hosted by SISU
​SISU & Fund/Build/Scale are joining forces for a LIVE Podcast the week of TechCrunch Disrupt! Walter Thompson will host a candid conversation about building early-stage consumer AI between Cristian Cibils Bernardes, founder and CEO of Autograph, and Cyan Banister, co-founder and general partner at Long Journey Ventures.

​Doors open at 6 p.m. Podcast will take place from 7 p.m. to 8 p.m., followed by light bites and networking with a group of founders, operators, and investors.
RSVP

AI Marketing Roundtable – with JustAI
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:30 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Just AI
Just AI (prev. Just Words) invites you to an intimate dinner with 15 of the Bay Area’s top CMOs and Lifecycle Marketing leaders. This curated gathering will focus on the real-world adoption of AI in marketing — the messy, practical journey from zero to one. We’ll dig into what it actually takes to go from testing a few automated workflows to building reliable systems that drive results. Expect candid conversations on what’s working, what’s not, and how teams are navigating the trade-offs as AI becomes a part of everyday marketing execution. ​Expect outstanding food, smart conversation, and a chance to connect with the leaders shaping the next wave of enterprise growth.
RSVP

IT Executive Dinner
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:30 p.m.
Hosted by Unthread
An exclusive dinner on the future of AI agents in IT service management (ITSM), where IT leaders from top global tech companies (some current customers) and industry peers will gather for an intimate conversation on innovation. This dinner is designed to promote candid, sales-free conversations among industry peers in a relaxed setting. With no presentations or pitches, just meaningful dialogue to connect, share, and learn from the brightest minds in enterprise IT.
This event will be most impactful for head of ITs and leaders scaling organizations. We will be curating the guest list very specifically. Thanks for understanding!

Thursday, October 30

Cafecito con Leche | Founders Breakfast
Thursday, October 30, 2025
9:00 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.
Hosted by Mappa AI
​Mappa.ai and JPMorgan are coming together to host an exclusive breakfast for Bay Area founders. This isn’t just another networking event — it’s a space to connect with fellow builders, swap hard-earned lessons, and talk about what it really takes to scale in today’s market.

​Expect fresh insights on fundraising, growth, and founder well-being—alongside some of the Bay’s most active investors, from Hustle Fund to Draper Associates. This is where founders walk out with their next check. Seats are limited, and the energy will be high 💛

AI Startup Job Fair
Thursday, October 30, 2025
1:00 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
Founder Social Club
Join us for the AI Startup Job Fair, connecting top AI and tech talent with 20+ fast-growing startups hiring across engineering, data science, and operations. Hosted by Founder Social Club, the event features startup booths, short introductions from sponsors, and curated résumé books to help job seekers stand out. Whether you’re a founder looking to hire or a professional exploring your next opportunity, this is where meaningful connections begin.

Find a Cofounder, Help or Join a Startup
Thursday, October 30, 2025
2:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by Startup Oasis
Welcome to Startup Oasis! If you are a startup founder, investor, developer, marketer, or anyone else in the tech ecosystem looking to start, join, or help a startup, this event is for you! Startup founders pitch their startups to the attendees (like on Shark Tank); then each founder gets a breakout room (that we curate) for you to talk to the founders, ask questions, and give feedback (similar to a hackathon). You are welcome to just watch as well.

If you would like to pitch, RSVP. You can also sign up on the day of the event. We are visiting SF for TechCrunch Disrupt and are hosting this special event after the conference! RSVP for more info.

Friday, October 31

Scaling Smartly – VC/Founder Panel and Networking
Friday, October 31, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Remotesome
Join us for an insightful evening focused on how startups can efficiently scale their teams — without compromising on quality, speed, or culture.

Hosted by Remotesome, as an official side event to TechCrunch Disrupt, this event brings together top VCs, founders, engineering leaders, and operators to share practical strategies for hiring, structuring, and managing distributed engineering teams.
item.content:encoded:
With TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 right around the corner, we’re thrilled to introduce the companies hosting Side Events that will extend the buzz and excitement to the thousands of attendees and Silicon Valley locals alike.

Whether it’s a fun happy hour, insightful panels, or energizing morning runs, Disrupt Week — happening from October 25-31 — offers an exciting array of Side Events organized by a diverse group of participating companies.

Scroll down to explore 50+ Side Events, built so you can connect with 10,000 Disrupt attendees and the rest of the Bay Area tech scene. Make sure to register for your Disrupt pass so you can be at the heart of the tech scene buzz. Save up to $444 on your pass and get 60% off a second pass.

Side Event guidelines and disclaimers

  • Registering/RSVPing to a Side Event does not grant you access/ticket/badge to TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, taking place October 27-29.
  • Each event is organized and operated solely by a host (not TechCrunch or any of its affiliates).
  • Attendance is 18+ minimum, and some venues are 21+ only.
  • Side Events are open to the public unless specified.
  • Please register/RSVP for any of the Side Events you want to attend.

Featured Side Events

JetBrains Night in San Francisco
Monday, October 27, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted by JetBrains
JetBrains invites you to an exclusive night of fun and connection at Emporium Arcade Bar during TechCrunch Disrupt in San Francisco. Get ready for an unforgettable evening of networking and arcade games, all in a relaxed, vibrant setting. Dive into the future of development with our thought leadership panel on agentic AI for professional developers and connect with the brightest minds in tech. This private, invitation-only event is where fun meets innovation, and ideas turn into opportunities. Let’s code, play, and shape the future together!

Central Eurasian Founders and Community Meet-up
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted by Silkroad Innovation Hub
Join us for the Central Eurasian Founders and Community Meet-up, hosted by Silkroad Innovation Hub as a side event to TechCrunch. This gathering brings together startup founders, investors, and ecosystem leaders from across Central Eurasia and Silicon Valley. Expect dynamic networking, inspiring founder stories, and new cross-border connections that highlight the region’s growing role in the global innovation landscape.

VIP Penthouse After-Hours with MongoDB & Google Cloud
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by MongoDB
VIP Penthouse After-Hours with MongoDB & Google Cloud is an exclusive, invite-only networking event that brings together tech innovators, startup leaders, cloud architects, and data professionals for an evening of high-level conversations and curated experiences. Held in a luxurious penthouse setting above the city skyline, the event blends sophisticated ambiance with cutting-edge technology discussions, offering attendees the opportunity to connect directly with MongoDB and Google Cloud experts.

TechCrunch Disrupt After-Party hosted by Mercury
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Mercury
​After a full day of big ideas at TechCrunch Disrupt, join us just minutes from Moscone for Mercury’s after-party: a space to slow down, connect with fellow builders, and celebrate the details that define your journey. No panels, no pitches — just good food, craft cocktails, and great company.

​Didn’t attend TechCrunch Disrupt? You’re still welcome to stop by.

All Aboard the Future: Poland & Silicon Valley Ignite the Next Wave of Innovation
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Polish Investment and Trade Agency
Step aboard the Historic Klamath Ship at Pier 9 on October 28 at 5 p.m. for an unforgettable night of bold ideas, breakthrough innovation, and powerful connections. Meet Poland’s top startups, visionary innovators, and government leaders driving the next wave of global tech. Enjoy delicious European cuisine and authentic Polish drinks and mingle with inspiring founders and investors. Special highlight: Be there for an exclusive announcement unveiling a new era of collaboration between Poland and Silicon Valley, a partnership set to become the next global hub for breakthrough ideas and cutting-edge technologies.

Irish Tech Pitch Night
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Enterprise Ireland
Enterprise Ireland is back at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 and we are so excited to welcome old friends and meet new ones at our Pitch Night in Ireland House on Tuesday of TechCrunch Disrupt Week! There we’ll hear pitches from 10 Irish startups on the night: Jarvio, Cergenx, Glitch, Magnate, Kayna, Akara, Hyperpath, Oscil, Oraion, CosoAI! Please register now as availability is limited!

Women Tech Meetup
Thursday, October 30, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Women Tech Meetup
San Francisco! Calling all female founders, allies, friends, and partners!
​​​​Let’s be real — fundraising isn’t one-size-fits-all. And for women founders? The rules aren’t just different — they’re nonexistent. That’s why we’re bringing together a powerhouse room of female founders, funders, and operators to talk about raising capital your way.

Saturday, October 25

Founders Running Club @ TechCrunch Disrupt
Saturday, October 25, 2025
9:30 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.
Hosted by Founders Running Club

We host weekly runs in San Francisco and 46 other locations worldwide for founders, their friends and families, investors, creators, tech professionals, and anyone interested. This time, we’re excited to again be part of TechCrunch Disrupt! The focus is on community and connection, not pushing yourself too hard.
RSVP

CREATANT AI x Creativity: Real-World Workflows, Demos, and Collaboration
Saturday, October 25, 2025
2:00 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
Hosted by CREATANT, Inc.
Join the CREATANT creative tech exchange to learn how creatives in Japan, Europe, and the U.S. are using AI for design, film, and more. The event offers live demos, real-world case studies, and open discussions on AI’s strengths and limitations. It’s a hands-on experience for creative professionals and marketers to explore new AI workflows, network, and exchange ideas with technologists and collaborators.
RSVP

Sunday, October 26

Rise & Grind SF: Coffee Rave + Live Podcast
Sunday, October 26, 2025
8:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.
Hosted by LaunchLink Communications
Consider Rise & Grind SF your Disrupt Week pregame. Part morning dance party, part live podcast, 100% good vibes.
Expect fresh brews, hot beats, and authentic connections. Whether you’re a founder, investor, or ecosystem partner, this is your daily dose of big ideas to set the tone for the week, courtesy of LaunchLink Comms + Humble Brags Podcast. Once you’re boogied out, a major Silicon Valley founder (think multibillion-dollar household name 👀) takes the mic for a live Humble Brags recording: unfiltered stories on building, breaking, and reinventing the game. Guest DJs + big brand collabs dropping soon. Come solo or with pals for coffee, connection, and a double shot of wisdom.

The Future of Work Mixer + Open Demos: Worktech, Agentic AI & Robotics
Sunday, October 26, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Good4work + Ontology of Value
Join us in the beautiful Minna Gallery, downtown San Francisco, for a social mixer and open demos, on the eve of the biggest tech conference in San Francisco, TechCrunch Disrupt 2025!

​We are a community focused on building (and disrupting!) the future of work — sharing and promoting innovation in work tech, agentic AI, and robotics so that humans and AI can happily cohabitate in the labor market and build a wonderful economy together.

​This time around, we are putting together a social mixer — whether you are a builder, operator, or investor, join us and let’s share our solutions and our lessons!
RSVP

AI SaaS Builder’s Networking Night
Sunday, October 26, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 9:30 p.m.
Hosted by askitmore
This event brings together aspiring entrepreneurs and startup enthusiasts to create professional slides using Snapdeck and pitch their ideas directly.

Pitch participants will prepare their presentation materials on-site using Snapdeck, then present their ideas for 3 minutes. General attendees can watch the presentations and vote for their top 1-3 most impressive teams.

During the networking session that follows, participants can enjoy free pizza and drinks while freely connecting with entrepreneurs, aspiring founders from diverse backgrounds to explore new opportunities.
RSVP

Monday, October 27

Future Shock: SOSV & KIAC
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by SOSV
🎬 Back to the Future? Absolutely.
This isn’t another stiff networking panel. Think flux capacitor energy: rice wine, demos glowing, and conversations skipping across borders and time zones. A gathering where casual meets geeky, and nerdy meets meaningful.
​​What to expect
​​Networking: Casual, high‑energy mixer designed for real conversations.
​Showcases and a few tables where startups showcase demos to maximize conditions for high‑quality collisions.

Ping Pong After Panels
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Scrut Automation
Scrut Automation is calling all CEOs, CTOs, founders, and CISO/VP of engineering to our “Ping Pong After Panels” After-Party. This is the official wind-down — a no-pitch, no-pressure zone to celebrate a hard day’s work.

Connect with fellow attendees over cold drinks, great food, and a little friendly competition. We’re swapping the formal handshakes for high fives and the buzz of the conference floor for a much better soundtrack. Plus, everything’s on us. Just come ready to relax and roll. ~This event has limited capacity and will fill up quickly. RSVP now to claim your spot~

Founders Happy Hour and Fireside Chat: Avoiding Identity and Compliance Scope Creep 👻 Hosted by Descope & Delve
Monday, October 27, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Descope
High-growth startups have tough decisions to make as they scale. As much as builders love to build, if everything is managed in-house with grit, sweat, and tears, growth will stall.
Join us for beer, pizza, networking, and an unfiltered fireside chat with founders from Descope and Delve.

Unlock Your Investor Potential: How Tech Workers Can Become LPs Using Vested Stock Units
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by Musa Capital
Are you a technology professional with vested stock units from companies like Google, Amazon, or Apple? Curious about how you can leverage those assets to become a limited partner (LP) in a venture capital (VC) fund? Join us for an exclusive Office Hours event where we’ll guide you through the process of converting your vested stock units into investments in VC funds.
RSVP

Exclusive Gathering of Founders Beyond Seed and Series A and Accredited Investors
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Equity X Investments, Vataseason, and Plus Ultra Capital Partners
An exclusive, invite-only gathering for post-seed and post-Series A founders and accredited investors.
No pitches or panels. Just high-value networking and real conversations over curated drinks in an intimate setting. Expect a vetted guest list and great opportunities for highly accomplished founders to meet partners of VCs and vice versa.
RSVP

Pitch&Drink with P2S.VC
Monday, October 27, 2025
7:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Pre-seed to succeed (AltaIR Capital, Yellow Rocks!, Smart Partnership Capital, I2BF Global Ventures)
Calling all founders looking for INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES to Pitch&Drink with P2S.vc!  Connect with a community of like-minded individuals and VCs and gain insights into your next fundraising venture in a relaxed and fun environment.

Think of it as venture speed dating. Founders will have 2–3 minutes to present their elevator pitch (no presentation) directly to investors, followed by a 6- to 7-minute Q&A session.
RSVP

TechCrunch Disrupt “Unofficial Afterparty” at Werqwise SF
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Silicon Valley Venture, LLC
Kick off TechCrunch Day 1 at our after-party, hosted by Brian Sparkes, CEO of Silicon Valley Venture and host of Silicon Valley Impact Podcast. This is The Day 1 Mixer — where founders, investors, and innovators gather to celebrate, connect, and unwind. Expect a curated crowd, high-energy vibe, cocktails, and conversations that spark real opportunities. No panels, no pitches — just celebration and connection at the top Silicon Valley after-party.
RSVP

South Asian Collective @ TechCrunch Disrupt Week
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:15 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by American South Asian Network (ASAN)
South Asian and under 50? Join us for an engaging evening of networking, insightful discussions, and cultural celebration. Connect with South Asian entrepreneurs, creatives, and professionals, and explore the vibrant contributions of the South Asian community across various industries.
What to expect
​✨ Powerful Networking
​🔥 Founder & Investor Spotlights
​🥂 Mixer & Social”
RSVP

Beyond the Hype: Voices from the Future of Humane AI — Short Film Screening & Panel
Monday, October 27, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by Building Humane Tech
Join us for an intimate screening of our documentary short featuring AI researchers, cognitive scientists, and innovative builders who are reimagining how we develop artificial intelligence. Followed by an informal panel and open discussion. This isn’t your typical tech panel — it’s a glimpse into a movement of interdisciplinary thinkers challenging the dominant Silicon Valley narrative, with folks like Danielle Perszyk from Amazon’s AI lab and Daniel Bashir from OpenAI.
RSVP

Unofficial Welcome Party: Bullish or Bust? A Rooftop AI Debate with Baseten, Premji Invest, and Treble PR
Monday, October 27, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Treble PR and Premji Invest
Join us after Day 1 of TechCrunch Disrupt for an invite-only night with AI founders and builders. Expect drinks, bites, and a conversation that’s equal parts real talk and future-gazing, cohosted by Premji Invest, a leading AI early-stage investor, and Treble PR, a San Francisco-based tech PR agency working with emerging leaders in AI.

Tuhin Srivastava of Baseten and Sandesh Patnam of Premji Invest, will answer questions from Reuters reporter Krystal Hu on why they’re still bullish on AI among eye-watering valuations and talk of a bubble.
RSVP

Night Zero: Unofficial Opening Party at TechCrunch Disrupt Week
Monday, October 27, 2025
8:00 p.m. – 10:30 p.m.
Hosted by Fox Rothschild and Silicon Valley Bank
Opening Night after-party in the heart of San Francisco hosted by Fox Rothschild and Silicon Valley Bank, with special partner UnDavos. Enjoy cocktails, light bites, and award-winning headliner DJ Samantha Michelle (Plaza Athénée/KitKatClub/SXSW/Soho House) in a premier venue designed for connection and celebration.

Bring your team to connect with other leading VCs and founders who are together shaping the future of tech. This is where partnerships are born and the night comes alive. Capacity is limited. Please apply to attend.
RSVP

Tuesday, October 28

Llama Lounge 21: The AI Startup Event Series at Capgemini
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Llama Lounge
Hundreds of AI Founders, VCs, and corporate AI buyers will assemble to hear 10 pitches from AI startups and 5 “reverse pitches” from top corporations who seek AI startup partners. This event is a mixture of AI leaders, pitches, demo tables, and lots of networking. Food and beverage provided. Led by Jeremiah Owyang, hosted at Capgemini.

The AI Renaissance in Gaming, Film, and VR
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by AIX Ventures
The last 3 years saw massive AI adoption for text-based applications. Its adoption in gaming, film, and VR has been limited by poor outputs and a lack of industry-specific applications. That’s rapidly changing.
Join AIX Ventures for a panel to discuss how new models and methods are poised to rapidly democratize the creation of immersive worlds and films.
Moderated by TechCrunch’s Russel Brandom, the panel will include Chris Manning, General Partner at AIX Ventures & fmr. Director of SAIL, and Fan‑Yun Sun and Sharon Lee, Founders of Moonlake AI, an AI research lab that allows anyone to create playable interactive worlds in minutes.

The After Crunch Party
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Salesbricks
Experience the Buzz of Asian Street Markets as we take TechCrunch Disrupt After Hours to a new level!
Join us at Polkcha, where craft cocktails meet the vibrant energy of Asian street markets — neon lights, bold flavors, and unforgettable vibes. Hosted by Salesbricks, Intercom, Sprinto, AutonomyAI, and Persana.

Black Box Session
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
4:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by Israel Foreign Trade Administration
Meet and have early conversations with some of the most promising Israeli cyber startups. Black Box Session is an invite-only, off-the-record networking + happy hour for VCs and security practitioners during TechCrunch Disrupt week. Expect meaningful connections and practical takeaways — no decks, no pitches. Tuesday, 4:30 p.m. –7:30 p.m., private FiDi venue. Request-to-attend; approved guests receive location, QR, and day-of details.

SaaS/AI Founder + Investor Happy Hour
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by NachoNacho + Services Marketplace, Deel, Anchin, and Shopline
Join us for an exclusive evening of networking with top SaaS and AI founders, investors, and tech leaders. Enjoy curated conversations over sponsored drinks and food as we bring together innovators shaping the next wave of tech. Attendance is by approval only — no plus-ones. Space is limited, so apply early to secure your spot.
RSVP

『Shinhan Square Bridge』 (S²Bridge) K-Innovators’ Pitch Night
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by SWITH
K-Innovators’ Night of Pitch & Networking
An exclusive evening of pitches and networking with Korea’s leading innovators. Meet and mingle with 9 standout startups, including TechCrunch Disrupt’s Startup Battlefield 200 participants! Build new connections with K-innovators and discover new ideas as you spark conversations. Food and drinks on SWITH. RSVP required — seats are limited.
RSVP

Beats & Builds Happy Hour with 219 Design and Beacon Launch Partners
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by 219 Design and Beacon Launch Partners
An exclusive evening at our classic San Francisco engineering shop — just a 15-minute walk from Moscone — savoring local craft beer, cocktails, tasty bites, and a live DJ.

This is a chance to unwind, get inspired, and spark new ideas alongside teams who live and breathe product development every day. Explore a collection of cutting-edge prototypes from a variety of industries and engage in conversations with the engineers, designers, and strategists behind breakthrough products. 21+
RSVP

Maize & Blue Happy Hour with U-M CFE
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by University of Michigan Center for Entrepreneurship
Join fellow University of Michigan alumni and friends for a casual meetup during TechCrunch Disrupt! Hosted by the Center for Entrepreneurship, this is a great opportunity to reconnect, expand your network, and celebrate innovation — with a Michigan twist. Whether you’re a founder, investor, technologist, or just love maize & blue, come share your startup spirit with us! Go Blue!
RSVP

Founder & Investor Happy Hour During TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by McDermott Will & Schulte, BDO, and Berkeley Angel Network
Join fellow TechCrunch Disrupt founders and investors for a fresh take on networking at the Founder and Investor Happy Hour hosted by McDermott Will & Schulte, BDO, and Berkeley Angel Network. Meet key innovators within the global tech community, exchange ideas, and forge new connections to drive your business forward. Don’t miss your chance to join this exclusive night of networking and enjoy some of the best rooftop views San Francisco has to offer — register today!
RSVP

Why Most Startups Don’t Scale: The 15 GTM Mistakes Nobody Talks About
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.
Hosted by Entry Point 1
You’ve nailed the product. You’ve raised the round. The team is running full speed. But the results don’t add up. Pipeline’s soft. Conversion’s flat. Revenue’s unpredictable. Is it the messaging? The team? The motion? Or is something more foundational — and systemic — getting in your way? This isn’t a hype session. It’s a teardown of the 15 GTM problems that stop great companies from scaling. Each one’s based on real data, real leadership stories from Silicon Valley, and real pain.
RSVP

The Robotics Wave: The New Era of Embodied Intelligence
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by INNOVIT — Italian Innovation & Cultural Hub
Let’s explore how AI and hardware are converging to create intelligent physical systems. Discover innovative robotics, embodied AI, and smart sensors revolutionizing manufacturing, healthcare, and autonomous systems. Attendees will attend a discussion panel with speakers on breakthrough technologies, and networking opportunities with industry pioneers shaping the future of intelligent machines and physical AI applications.
RSVP

PILAF AFTER-PARTY: Visionaries’ Rooftop Gathering
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted by Innova and BeGlobe
When the final session closes, the city’s most influential minds ascend to the skyline. Join us for the Legendary Pilaf After-Party, a private rooftop gathering where cutting-edge innovation meets the world’s finest culinary. The evening Includes:
​- Gourmet Pilaf Tasting: Tradition elevated to haute cuisine.
​- Visionary Networking: Intimate conversations with the leaders shaping the future.
RSVP

How AI Is Transforming Biomanufacturing
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by SOSV
Bits in Bio is thrilled to present “How AI Is Transforming Biomanufacturing,” a one-night event of candid conversations from experienced executives on the front lines of biomanufacturing. ​Our panel includes a range of perspectives carefully curated to drive meaningful insight on the future of this exciting field.

Global Founders Panel
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Young Professionals of San Francisco + Swedish American Chamber of Commerce
During TechCrunch Disrupt week, we’re bringing together a community of young doers, builders, and dreamers for an evening that blends the best of Swedish and American entrepreneurship. The Global Founders Panel is designed to spark ideas, celebrate bold thinking, and create meaningful connections that last well beyond the night.
Program highlights
• Founder Panel: Entrepreneurs share real stories from the startup frontlines.
• Spotlight Sessions: Quick-fire showcases of ventures that are pushing boundaries.
• Networking Mixer: Meet founders, investors, and young professionals shaping what’s next.

Disrupt the Piñata: Startup–VC Mixer with a Latin Twist
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Unibaio
Step into a one-of-a-kind networking experience where Latin American creativity meets startup innovation. In Disrupt the Piñata, attendees drop their business cards or one-liners into a colorful piñata filled with sweet surprises. Once it’s broken, everyone grabs a card at random, introduces the startup they picked to the group, and then connects directly with that founder.

This playful icebreaker ensures every participant gets visibility, sparks unexpected connections, and sets the stage for deeper conversations. With a mix of fun, culture, and serious business opportunities, Disrupt the Piñata is the perfect side event to showcase Latin startups and foster genuine VC–founder relationships.

Founders, Funders & the Future of Care Mixer
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Morrison & Foerster Law Firm and Vital Audio
This invite-only happy hour will bring together 90–120 curated guests of decision-makers shaping the future of healthcare, including early-stage investors, hospital and virtual-care operators, digital health founders, and TechCrunch media. Expect a dynamic program featuring:

  • Founders Spotlight: Short sessions highlighting rising founders and product showcase.
  • Sponsor Shoutouts: Premium visibility and recognition for our partners.
  • Curated Networking: 2.5 hours of conversations, connections, and collaboration over drinks and light catering.

Disrupt Music @ EMPIRE Studios by Nebula
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Nebula, sponsored by EMPIRE
Mixer happy hour with a DJ spinning live music, snacks and drinks at EMPIRE RECORDS Studios hosted by Nebula.

EMPIRE is a partner and investor of Nebula (a member of Battlefield 200) and is the largest independent record label in the world. EMPIRE, founded by Ghazi, is a San Francisco-born tech-first record label that pioneered the distribution space.

The event will include press, tech entrepreneurs, investors, established artists, and top management of EMPIRE, along with the Nebula co-founders. The mixer will be free entry, RSVP-only (via the RSVPify app).
RSVP

Silicon Valley x PeakNIL: The Future of Sports, Tech and Start Ups
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by PeakNIL
Kick back with PeakNIL at our happy hour where athletes, founders, and investors collide. Grab a drink, meet PeakNIL co-founder, chief strategy officer, and LA Ram Blake Corum, and discover how NIL is shaking up the business of sports and culture. Expect networking, fresh ideas, and a good time with the team behind the fastest growing NIL company.
RSVP

AI-Matched Private Dinners with TechTable by Cyber Pop-up
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
7:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Cyber Pop-up
TechTable connects professionals through curated, AI-matched private dining that sparks authentic conversations. Each table gets curated conversation cards on tech, AI, and more — creating space for meaningful dialogue without the chaos of big networking rooms. No awkward small talk, just inspiring people, real connections, and great food.
RSVP

SignalFire’s Disrupt Poolside After-Party
Tuesday, October 28, 2025
7:00 p.m. – Midnight
Hosted by SignalFire
The most talked-about after-party at TechCrunch Disrupt is back!
​Last year, our Disrupt Penthouse After-Party drew over 3,000 registrations, but we could only accommodate a fraction of attendees. It became the most exclusive and talked-about event of the week, bringing together founders, investors, and top tech operators for a night of high-energy connection and celebration.

​This year, we’re leveling up and going poolside 🌴💦.
New venue. Bigger capacity. Even better vibes.

​We’re taking over an iconic San Francisco location for one unforgettable night. We’ll have immersive experiences, live musical performances, and fun surprises that will make it the highlight of your Disrupt week.

Wednesday, October 29

Tech Meets Tavern Happy Hour
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by OneSignal
You’ve been pitching, networking, and learning all day. Now it’s time to kick back at OneSignal’s exclusive post-Disrupt happy hour.

Join us at the iconic Wayfare Tavern, located less than a mile from the conference. You can enjoy premium cocktails, gourmet hors d’oeuvres (bring your appetite!), and great conversation with fellow founders, marketers, and tech innovators in a relaxed and upscale setting that is perfect for unwinding after a busy day.

HardTech After Party @Whipsaw
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
5:30 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.
Hosted by Whipsaw
Are you building the future of hardware? Come connect with fellow founders, engineers, and investors who are pushing the boundaries of hard tech from robotics and wearables to connected devices, medtech, and beyond.

​An evening of conversation, community, and collaboration for hardware enthusiasts straight from the TechCrunch Disrupt floor. Enjoy delicious food and drinks, all set to the sounds of a live DJ. Expect a mix of deep tech founders, product innovators, and design leaders who are solving real-world problems with bold hardware solutions.
RSVP

UAtech Venture Night @Disrupt – The Ultimate Startup & Investor Experience!
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.
Hosted b y UAtech
UAtech Venture Night @ Disrupt is a fast-paced pitch competition where early-stage founders present sharp 3-minute pitches to an audience of active investors and tech leaders. Live scoring and rapid Q&A keep the energy high and deal-focused. A panel discussion with industry experts sets the stage, followed by an awards ceremony and active networking — connecting capital, ideas, and innovation to fuel the next wave of global tech.

Fright Night: Product Failures
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by blok
Halloween is around the corner, and so are the ghosts of failed launches, terrifying drop-offs, and features that should have stayed buried. Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Draper Startup House Korea
​The Rise-up Pitch Showcase organized by Draper Startup House Korea, Draper University and Nuleep, brings together 6 of Korea’s most promising startups for an exclusive pitch event in Silicon Valley. Handpicked through a highly selective process, these companies are beyond early stage — they’re ready to attract investment and secure strategic partnerships that will accelerate their U.S. expansion. This is a rare opportunity to meet the next generation of Korean innovators, each equipped with the technology, resilience, and global readiness to scale successfully in the world’s most competitive market.

Meet & Match in Tech: Founders Hiring × Devs Exploring

6:00 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Beta University
Where builders, backers, and bold ideas collide.

​Whether you’re a founder fundraising, a VC sourcing your next breakout bet, or an operator looking to plug into the ecosystem, Founderverse is where it all comes together.
What to expect:
​🚀 Founders, VCs, and tech operators
​⚡ Lightning pitches from rising startups
​🏷️ Color-coded badges (so you know who’s who)
​🍸 Drinks, music, and no-bullshit networking
No panels. No fluff. Just the right people in the right room. ​Spots are limited — RSVP required.

Techcrunch event

San Francisco | October 27-29, 2025

SISU x Fund/Build/Scale LIVE Podcast & Mixer
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:00 p.m. – 9:30 p.m.
Hosted by SISU
​SISU & Fund/Build/Scale are joining forces for a LIVE Podcast the week of TechCrunch Disrupt! Walter Thompson will host a candid conversation about building early-stage consumer AI between Cristian Cibils Bernardes, founder and CEO of Autograph, and Cyan Banister, co-founder and general partner at Long Journey Ventures.

​Doors open at 6 p.m. Podcast will take place from 7 p.m. to 8 p.m., followed by light bites and networking with a group of founders, operators, and investors.

AI Marketing Roundtable – with JustAI
Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:30 p.m. – 8:30 p.m.
Hosted by Just AI
Just AI (prev. Just Words) invites you to an intimate dinner with 15 of the Bay Area’s top CMOs and Lifecycle Marketing leaders. This curated gathering will focus on the real-world adoption of AI in marketing — the messy, practical journey from zero to one. We’ll dig into what it actually takes to go from testing a few automated workflows to building reliable systems that drive results. Expect candid conversations on what’s working, what’s not, and how teams are navigating the trade-offs as AI becomes a part of everyday marketing execution. ​Expect outstanding food, smart conversation, and a chance to connect with the leaders shaping the next wave of enterprise growth.

Wednesday, October 29, 2025
6:30 p.m.
Hosted by Unthread
An exclusive dinner on the future of AI agents in IT service management (ITSM), where IT leaders from top global tech companies (some current customers) and industry peers will gather for an intimate conversation on innovation. With no presentations or pitches, just meaningful dialogue to connect, share, and learn from the brightest minds in enterprise IT.
This event will be most impactful for head of ITs and leaders scaling organizations. We will be curating the guest list very specifically. Thanks for understanding!

Thursday, October 30

Thursday, October 30, 2025
9:00 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.
Hosted by Mappa AI

​Expect fresh insights on fundraising, growth, and founder well-being—alongside some of the Bay’s most active investors, from Hustle Fund to Draper Associates. This is where founders walk out with their next check. Seats are limited, and the energy will be high 💛

AI Startup Job Fair
Thursday, October 30, 2025
1:00 p.m. – 4:00 p.m.
Founder Social Club
Join us for the AI Startup Job Fair, connecting top AI and tech talent with 20+ fast-growing startups hiring across engineering, data science, and operations. Hosted by Founder Social Club, the event features startup booths, short introductions from sponsors, and curated résumé books to help job seekers stand out. Whether you’re a founder looking to hire or a professional exploring your next opportunity, this is where meaningful connections begin.

Find a Cofounder, Help or Join a Startup
Thursday, October 30, 2025
2:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.
Hosted by Startup Oasis
Welcome to Startup Oasis! If you are a startup founder, investor, developer, marketer, or anyone else in the tech ecosystem looking to start, join, or help a startup, this event is for you! Startup founders pitch their startups to the attendees (like on Shark Tank); then each founder gets a breakout room (that we curate) for you to talk to the founders, ask questions, and give feedback (similar to a hackathon). You are welcome to just watch as well.

If you would like to pitch, RSVP. You can also sign up on the day of the event. We are visiting SF for TechCrunch Disrupt and are hosting this special event after the conference! RSVP for more info.

Friday, October 31

Scaling Smartly – VC/Founder Panel and Networking
Friday, October 31, 2025
5:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.
Hosted by Remotesome
Join us for an insightful evening focused on how startups can efficiently scale their teams — without compromising on quality, speed, or culture.

Hosted by Remotesome, as an official side event to TechCrunch Disrupt, this event brings together top VCs, founders, engineering leaders, and operators to share practical strategies for hiring, structuring, and managing distributed engineering teams.

item.title: OpenAI wants to power your browser, and that might be a security nightmare (AI News & Artificial Intelligence | TechCrunch)
item.description:
The browser wars are heating up again, this time with AI in the driver’s seat. 

OpenAI just launched Atlas, a ChatGPT-powered browser that lets users surf the web using natural language and even includes an “agent mode” that can complete tasks autonomously. It’s one of the biggest browser launches in recent memory, but it’s debuting with an unsolved security flaw that could expose passwords, emails, and sensitive data. 

On TechCrunch’s Equity podcast, Max Zeff, Anthony Ha, and Sean O’Kane break down Atlas’ debut, the broader wave of alternative browsers, and more of the week’s startup and tech news. 

Listen to the full episode to hear about: 

  • Why Rivian spinoff Also just landed a massive deal with Amazon for thousands of pedal-assist cargo vehicles (and why the name is a nightmare to say in conversation) 
  • The alternative browsers that either embrace or push back against AI-everything, from privacy-focused options like DuckDuckGo and Brave to “mindful” browsers like Opera Air 

Subscribe to Equity on Apple Podcasts, Overcast, Spotify and all the casts. You also can follow Equity on X and Threads, at @EquityPod.

item.title: Microsoft’s Mico heightens the risks of parasocial LLM relationships (AI – Ars Technica)
item.description:
“It looks like you’re trying to find a friend. Would you like help?”

I love you too, Mico. Credit: Microsoft

Microsoft is rolling out a new face for its AI, and its name is Mico. The company announced the new, animated blob-like avatar for Copilot’s voice mode yesterday as part of a “human-centered” rebranding of Microsoft’s Copilot AI efforts.

Mico is part of a Microsoft program dedicated to the idea that “technology should work in service of people,” Microsoft wrote. The company insists this effort is “not [about] chasing engagement or optimizing for screen time. We’re building AI that gets you back to your life. That deepens human connection.”

Mico has drawn instant and obvious comparisons to Clippy, the animated paperclip that popped up to offer help with Microsoft Office starting in the ’90s. Microsoft has leaned into this comparison with an Easter egg that can transform Mico into an animated Clippy.

“Clippy walked so that we could run,” Microsoft AI Corporate VP Jacob Andreou joked in an interview with The Verge. “We all live in Clippy’s shadow in some sense.”

But while Clippy was an attempt to strengthen our connection to sterile Windows Help menus, Mico seems focused more on strengthening the parasocial relationships many people are already developing with LLMs. The defining interaction with Clippy was along the lines of “It looks like you’re writing a letter, would you like some help?” With Mico, the idea seems to be “It looks like you’re trying to find a friend. Would you like help?”

Just another voice from the black rectangle

The term “parasocial relationship” was coined by academics in the ’50s to describe the feeling of intimacy that can develop between an audience and a media celebrity. Through repeated exposure, members of the audience can come to feel like they know the celebrity as a friend, even if the celebrity doesn’t know them at all.

While mass media like radio, movies, and television can all feed into parasocial relationships, the Internet and smartphone revolutions have supercharged the opportunities we all have to feel like an online stranger is a close, personal confidante. From YouTube and podcast personalities to Instagram influencers or even your favorite blogger/journalist (hi), it’s easy to feel like you have a close connection with the people who create the content you see online every day.

Viewing all this content on a smartphone can flatten all these media and real-life personalities into a kind of undifferentiated media sludge. It can be all too easy to slot an audio message from your romantic partner into the same mental box as a stranger chatting about video games in a podcast. “When my phone does little mating calls of pings and buzzes, it could bring me updates from people I love, or show me alerts I never asked for from corporations hungry for my attention,” Julie Beck writes in an excellent Atlantic article about this phenomenon. “Picking my loved ones out of the never-ending stream of stuff on my phone requires extra effort.”

This is the world Mico seems to be trying to slide into, turning Copilot into another not-quite-real relationship mediated through your mobile device. But unlike the Instagram model who never seems to acknowledge your comments, Mico is always there to respond with a friendly smile and a warm, soothing voice.

AI that “earns your trust”

Text-based AI interfaces are already frighteningly good at faking human personality in a way that encourages this kind of parasocial relationship, sometimes with disastrous results. But adding a friendly, Pixar-like face to Copilot’s voice mode may make it much easier to be sucked into feeling like Copilot isn’t just a neural network but a real, caring personality—one you might even start thinking of the same way you’d think of the real loved ones in your life.

Microsoft even admits that this is the point on some level. Twice in its “human-centered AI” announcement, the company talks about wanting to build an AI that “earns your trust.” Mico in particular “shows up with warmth [and] personality” by “react[ing] like someone who truly listens,” making “voice conversations feel more natural… [and] creating a friendly and engaging experience.” In his Verge interview, Andreou said that with Mico, “all the technology fades into the background, and you just start talking to this cute orb and build this connection with it.”

That sounds less like technology focused on “deepen[ing] human connection” and more like the kind of technology that’s about “chasing engagement or optimizing for screen time.” After all, an AI that’s easier to talk to is an AI you’ll want to talk to more—and potentially pay more to access. If an AI chatbot with a warm, friendly face “earns your trust,” you’re a lot less likely to listen to the AI skeptics that generate what Microsoft calls “a lot of noise around AI.”

It’s unclear if Mico will end up being a beloved parasocial friend to millions of Copilot users or more of an ironically remembered annoyance like Clippy. But it won’t be the last attempt to put a cute, trustworthy face on large language models that don’t necessarily merit that level of trust. And we should all be wary of the parasocial psychology these efforts can feed into.

Lexus Lunar Lorry
The company insists this effort is “not [about] chasing engagement or optimizing for screen time. We’re building AI that gets you back to your life. That deepens human connection.”
So will Microsoft consider Mico to be a success if it drives people away from the computer and back into real life to build human connections in meatspace? Or would that be considered a disaster due to declining engagement and screen time metrics?
October 24, 2025 at 5:17 pm
